message: Hi Arjun! What’s the single feature you’d like specced out today? Just give me a quick description or intent, and I’ll clarify any details before drafting the Smartsheet row.

Thanks, Aanya! I’d like to see a feature that enables users to export their project data as a CSV directly from the dashboard. This would help teams quickly analyze or share their project info outside the app. Let me know what details you need before you spec it out.

Great start! A couple of clarifying questions before I draft the spec:

1. Should the export include all project data, or just what’s visible in the current dashboard view (e.g., filtered/sorted columns)?
2. Are there any permissions or roles that should be required to use the export feature?
3. Should the export be triggered via a button, menu item, or something else?
4. Any specific fields or metadata you want always included in the CSV (e.g., timestamps, user info)?

Once I have these details, I’ll whip up a crisp Smartsheet spec row for you!

Here’s my take:

1. Export should reflect the current dashboard view—only filtered/sorted columns and rows, so users get exactly what they see.
2. Limit export to users with “Editor” or higher permissions to prevent data leaks.
3. Trigger via a clear “Export CSV” button at the top right of the dashboard for easy access.
4. Always include project ID, project name, last modified timestamp, and owner—even if those columns are hidden—so exports are traceable.

Let me know if you need anything else before drafting!

message: Sheet and row are shaping up well! Once you’ve filled in the description and acceptance criteria, let me know. I’ll then create and link the Linear issue to this spec row.

The spec row is now fully drafted! Here’s what’s in Smartsheet:

- Feature Name: Export Project Data as CSV
- Description: Users can export their current dashboard view as a CSV, matching filters/sorts, always including key metadata, and limited to Editors+.
- Acceptance Criteria (4 clear points, as discussed).

Let me know once you’ve created the Linear issue—then I’ll link it directly to this spec row for seamless tracking!

arguments.value: Enable users to export their current dashboard view as a CSV file. Exported data should match visible filters/sorts, include key project metadata, and be accessible only to users with Editor or higher permissions.

1. Exported CSV reflects current dashboard filters, sorts, and visible columns/rows.
2. Export always includes project ID, project name, last modified timestamp, and owner, even if hidden in the view.
3. Only users with Editor or higher permissions can access the export feature.
4. "Export CSV" button is clearly visible at the top right of the dashboard and triggers the download.

message: Aanya, I don’t see a dedicated “dashboard” or “engineering” project in Linear—just legacy projects like Tapestry 5, Apache Cassandra, and TomEE. Should I create this feature under one of these, or do you want a new project set up for dashboard features? Let me know your preference before I proceed.

message:
Thanks for flagging that, Arjun! Since this feature is for the dashboard and doesn’t fit neatly into the legacy projects, I recommend creating a new Linear project specifically for dashboard features. This will keep things organized and make future tracking much easier.

Once the “Dashboard Features” project is set up, you can create the issue there and I’ll handle the cross-linking in Smartsheet. Sound good?

The “Dashboard Features” project is now set up in Linear, and I’ve created the issue for the CSV export feature. Here’s the issue link for your cross-linking in Smartsheet:  
https://linear.app/tap5/issue/TAP5-2831/export-project-data-as-csv-from-dashboard

Let me know once it’s linked, and I’ll keep the issue updated as work progresses.

arguments.name: Dashboard Features
arguments.summary: Central place for all dashboard-related enhancements and features.
arguments.description: Tracks features and improvements for the user dashboard, including export, filtering, and UI enhancements.

arguments.title: Export Project Data as CSV from Dashboard
arguments.description:
Users can export their current dashboard view as a CSV file. Exported data should:
- Match current filters, sorts, and visible columns/rows
- Always include project ID, project name, last modified timestamp, and owner (even if hidden)
- Be accessible only to users with Editor or higher permissions
- Be triggered via a clear 'Export CSV' button at the top right of the dashboard

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Exported CSV reflects current dashboard filters, sorts, and visible columns/rows.
2. Export always includes project ID, project name, last modified timestamp, and owner, even if hidden in the view.
3. Only users with Editor or higher permissions can access the export feature.
4. 'Export CSV' button is clearly visible at the top right of the dashboard.

Spec row: Feature Specs sheet, row 1 (ID 28).

You can update progress in Linear, and I’ll keep an eye on the Smartsheet side. If you need any further specs or want to discuss acceptance test details, just let me know!
